subsection.name: Scripts Component
subsection.p: Convenience component for rendering all the scripts necessary for using the jsf-extensions ajax feature. Place this inside <f:view> yet before any usages of the AJAX JavaScript objects. Subsequent occurrences of this tag in the page will produce no output.

subsection.name: Faces.Event
subsection.p: This class extends the Ajax.Request class from the Prototype JavaScript Library and adds a bit of functionality specific to JSF.

Where ANY_HTML_OR_JSF_ELEMENT is any jsf component or HTML element from which you emit the event, |EVENT| is any javascript event supported by that element, such as onmousedown, onclick, onblur, etc, and { |OPTIONS| } is an optional argument that is a JavaScript associative array supporting the following options.

dd.p: Comma separated string containing a list of client ids against which the execute portion of the request processing lifecycle must be run. If not specified, the value of the render parameter is used. If that is not specified, the entire view is traversed during the execute portion of the request proecssing lifecycle.
Comma separated string containing a list of client ids against which the render portion of the request processing lifecycle must be run. If not specified, the entire view is rendered.

Comma separated string containing a list of client ids of input elements whose values should be submitted to the server. If not specified, all the values of all input elements in the current form are submitted.

If specified, must be the only option, and must conform to the above syntax, where |CLIENT_ID| is the client id of the component to be the source of the event, |EVENT_NAME| is a JavaBeans property name of an event method on the component identified by the |CLIENT_ID| parameter, and the optional immediate value indicates that the event should run during apply request values, rather than invoke application.

If specified, this is a JavaScript associative array object that will be sent up to the server in the X-JSON header. This value may be operated on by the server. The possibly modified value will be returned to the client as the last argument in the replaceElementHook and/or the postInstallHook.
The name of a globally scoped function that conforms to the following signature.

This function is called for each component that needs to be re-rendered with data from this ajax response. The function is expected to take the content of the content argument and replace the DOM element referenced by the id argument. The function is expected to invoke any scripts that may be present in content. The optional argument closure is whatever was passed as the closure option to the Faces.Event or Faces.Command that initiated the ajax request for this response.
The name of a globally scoped function that conforms to the following signature.

This function is called after the markup replacement for each component that needs to be re-rendered with data from this ajax response. The optional argument closure is whatever was passed as the closure option to the Faces.Event or Faces.Command that initiated the ajax request for this response.

subsection.name: Faces.Command
subsection.p: This class extends Faces.Event and uses the Prototype Event.observe feature to cause a Faces.Event to be emitted from a specific element in the DOM.
